original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"We are His workmanship created in Christ Jesus for good works, _

_which God prepared beforehand so that we would walk in them." _

_(Eph. 2:10)_

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

We are God's masterpiece, In the matter of salvation, we are the

product of the will and work of God. We are saved APART from

good works, but saved UNTO good works. Good works are the aim

of our salvation and the evidence of our faith. .

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

I thank You Lord, for the gift of salvation, a true gift because

of Christ's willingness to pay the debt for my sins on the Cross. .
Amen.
original_reflection_text: We are God's masterpiece, In the matter of salvation, we are the product of the will and work of God. We are saved APART from good works, but saved UNTO good works. Good works are the aim of our salvation and the evidence of our faith. .
original_verse_text: "We are His workmanship created in Christ Jesus for good works, which God prepared beforehand so that we would walk in them. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, grateful for the gift of salvation that You have freely bestowed upon us. We acknowledge that we are Your masterpiece, created in Christ Jesus for the purpose of doing good works, which You have prepared in advance for us to do. May our lives reflect the transformative power of Your grace, as we walk in the newness of life, bearing the fruit of our faith. Guide us, Lord, to live in a manner worthy of the calling we have received, to the glory of Your name. Amen.
reflection: We are God's masterpiece. In the matter of salvation, we are the product of the will and work of God. We are saved apart from good works, but saved unto good works. Good works are the aim of our salvation and the evidence of our faith.
subject: Saved for Good Works
verse_text: “We are His workmanship created in Christ Jesus for good works, which God prepared beforehand so that we would walk in them. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Remember that at one time you were separate from Christ;_

_but now in Christ Jesus you who were formerly far off have_

_been brought _ near by the blood of Christ." (Eph. 2:12a, 13)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

This is what God has done, we have been brought near by the blood

of Christ NOT by the sincerity of our repentance, NOT by the strength

of our faith, NOT by the depth of our devotion, NOT by the joy of our

spiritual experience. A new relationship has been sealed with the

sacrificial blood of Christ. .

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I cannot begin to put into human terms my thankfulness

for the new relationship I now have with You because of Your death

upon the cross, hELP ME to remain in this new relationship. Amen.
original_reflection_text: This is what God has done, we have been brought near by the blood of Christ NOT by the sincerity of our repentance, NOT by the strength of our faith, NOT by the depth of our devotion, NOT by the joy of our spiritual experience. A new relationship has been sealed with the sacrificial blood of Christ. .
original_verse_text: "Remember that at one time you were separate from Christ; but now in Christ Jesus you who were formerly far off have been brought near by the blood of Christ. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that it is not by our own merit, but by the precious blood of Christ that we have been brought near to You. We thank You for the new relationship You have established, not through our own efforts, but through the sacrifice of Your Son. May we ever be mindful of Your grace and the unity we share in Christ, that we may live as a people reconciled to You and to one another. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: This is what God has done. We have been brought near by the blood of Christ, not by the sincerity of our repentance, not by the strength of our faith, not by the depth of our devotion, not by the joy of our spiritual experience. A new relationship has been sealed with the sacrificial blood of Christ.
subject: Brought Near by Christ's Blood
verse_text: “Remember that at one time you were separate from Christ; but now in Christ Jesus you who were formerly far off have been brought near by the blood of Christ. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"For He Himself is our peace, who made both groups one,_

(Jew and Gentile) _and broke down the barrier of the dividing _

_wall." _(Eph. 2:14)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Christ is our peace with God and each other without distinction.

A new unity has been established where race and national

distinction disappear in Christ (Gal. 3:28)

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord You accomplished for us what no man was

capable of doing, because of our sinful nature. Help us

remain true and faithful to our Heavenly Father. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Christ is our peace with God and each other without distinction. A new unity has been established where race and national distinction disappear in Christ (Galatians 3:28)
original_verse_text: "For He Himself is our peace, who made both groups one, (Jew and Gentile) and broke down the barrier of the dividing wall. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for the peace that Christ has brought, breaking down the dividing walls that once separated us. In Your Son, all distinctions of race, nationality, and social status fade away, and we are united as one family under Your loving care. Help us to walk in this unity, embracing one another as brothers and sisters in Christ, that the world may see Your reconciling power at work. Amen.
reflection: Christ is our peace with God and each other without distinction. A new unity has been established where race and national distinction disappear in Christ (Galatians 3:28).
subject: Oneness in Christ Transcends Divisions
verse_text: “For He Himself is our peace, who made both groups one, (Jew and Gentile) and broke down the barrier of the dividing wall. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Having abolished in His flesh the enmity, that is, the law _

_of commandments contained in ordinances, so as to create_

_in Himself one new man from the two, thus making peace."_

(Eph. 2:15)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Only Christ's crucified body can effect so great a task as to
reconcile

and reunite hostile members of the human race. Christ is the world's

only hope. Christ's body, the church, is the one new man, made up of

new men (2 Cor. 5:17) Christ puts an end to hostility between God

and man and between man and man.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear heavenly Father, I thank You for making all things new

in the way of salvation through the shed blood of Christ on the

cross. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Only Christ's crucified body can effect so great a task as to reconcile and reunite hostile members of the human race. Christ is the world's only hope. Christ's body, the church, is the one new man, made up of new men (2 Corinthians 5:17) Christ puts an end to hostility between God and man and between man and man.
original_verse_text: "Having abolished in His flesh the enmity, that is, the law of commandments contained in ordinances, so as to create in Himself one new man from the two, thus making peace. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, humbled by the truth that only through the sacrifice of Your Son, Jesus Christ, can true reconciliation and unity be found. We praise You for the power of the cross, which has the ability to put an end to the hostility that divides us from You and from one another. Lord, may Your church, the body of Christ, be a testament to the new life and restored relationships that are possible through faith in Your Son. We ask that You would continue to work in us, transforming us into the new creation You have called us to be. Amen.
reflection: Only Christ's crucified body can effect so great a task as to reconcile and reunite hostile members of the human race. Christ is the world's only hope. Christ's body, the church, is the one new man, made up of new men (2 Corinthians 5:17). Christ puts an end to hostility between God and man and between man and man.
subject: The World's Only Hope
verse_text: “Having abolished in His flesh the enmity, that is, the law of commandments contained in ordinances, so as to create in Himself one new man from the two, thus making peace. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Christ came and preached peace to you who were far_

_off and to those who were near. For through Him we_

_ both have access by one Spirit to the Father." _(Eph. 2:17, 18)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

By His death He procured peace, and by His servants He

proclaims peace. THROUGH HIM--we have a continuous,

common unhindered approach to God. Through Christ all

believers can "come boldly unto the throne of Grace.

(Heb. 4:16)

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

I thank You, for the open door Your Son made for us to

Your Throne by way of the Holy Spirit . Amen.
original_reflection_text: By His death He procured peace, and by His servants He proclaims peace. THROUGH HIM--we have a continuous, common unhindered approach to God. Through Christ all believers can "come boldly unto the throne of Grace. (Hebrews 4:16)
original_verse_text: "Christ came and preached peace to you who were far off and to those who were near. For through Him we both have access by one Spirit to the Father. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, for through Your Son, Jesus Christ, we have been granted peace and unhindered access to Your throne of grace. We thank You that we can approach You boldly, knowing that we will find mercy and grace to help us in our time of need. Lord, may we ever be mindful of the great sacrifice made on our behalf, and may we live in the power of Your Spirit, proclaiming the peace that only You can provide. Amen.
reflection: By His death, He procured peace, and by His servants, He proclaims peace. Through Him, we have a continuous, common, unhindered approach to God. Through Christ, all believers can “come boldly unto the throne of Grace.“ (Hebrews 4:16)
subject: Unhindered Access to God's Throne
verse_text: “Christ came and preached peace to you who were far off and to those who were near. For through Him we both have access by one Spirit to the Father. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Now, therefore, you are no longer strangers and foreigners,_

_but fellow citizens with the saints and members of the household _

_of God. _(Eph. 2:19)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Here is the first thought--the second word in our verse today

is THEREFORE. So what is the THEREFORE there-for? Well it should

draw us back to yesterdays verse. In verse 18 we are told that

"THROUGH Jesus we have access to the Father." So we now see

that because of this act we are members of the household of

God, which means we will receive the gift of eternal life.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

I thank You Lord Jesus for the gift You made available to Me

by Your love, there is no way to express this wonderful gift

accept by remaining faithful and trusting in You. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Here is the first thought--the second word in our verse today is THEREFORE. So what is the THEREFORE therefor? Well it should draw us back to yesterdays verse. In verse 18 we are told that "THROUGH Jesus we have access to the Father. " So we now see that because of this act we are members of the household of God, which means we will receive the gift of eternal life.
original_verse_text: "Now, therefore, you are no longer strangers and foreigners, but fellow citizens with the saints and members of the household of God.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, for through the sacrifice of Your Son, Jesus, we have been granted access to Your presence and made members of Your eternal household. We rejoice in the peace and hope that You have bestowed upon us, and we long to live as Your faithful children, walking in the light of Your love. Guide us, Lord, that we may honor You in all we do and eagerly anticipate the fulfillment of Your promises. Amen.
reflection: Here is the first thought—the second word in our verse today is THEREFORE. So what is the THEREFORE therefore? Well, it should draw us back to yesterday's verse. In verse 18, we are told that “THROUGH Jesus we have access to the Father.“ So we now see that because of this act, we are members of the household of God, which means we will receive the gift of eternal life.
subject: Eternal Life Through Jesus
verse_text: “Now, therefore, you are no longer strangers and foreigners, but fellow citizens with the saints and members of the household of God.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Members of the household of God--having been built _

_on the foundation of the apostles and prophets, Jesus _

_Christ __Himself being the chief corner-stone." _(Eph. 2:19b-20)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

HOUSE-HOLD OF GOD--suggests the fellowship enjoyed by

God's family. Paul changes the figure of speech from a

family to a spiritual temple in setting forth the unifying

characteristic of the church, of which Christ is not only

the Chief corner stone but also the foundation.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

I thank You Lord for the awesome corner-stone and foundation

You have built Your church upon, who was willing to sacrifice

His life to save all who would believe in Him. Amen
original_reflection_text: HOUSEHOLD OF GOD--suggests the fellowship enjoyed by God's family. Paul changes the figure of speech from a family to a spiritual temple in setting forth the unifying characteristic of the church, of which Christ is not only the Chief corner stone but also the foundation.
original_verse_text: "Members of the household of God--having been built on the foundation of the apostles and prophets, Jesus Christ Himself being the chief cornerstone. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You as Your beloved children, united in the fellowship of Your household. We are Your temple, indwelt by Your Holy Spirit, and built upon the foundation of Christ, the Chief Cornerstone. Grant us wisdom and discernment to guard and preserve this sacred dwelling place, that we may honor You in all we do. May our lives reflect the unity and holiness that You desire for Your Church. We ask this in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ. Amen.
reflection: HOUSEHOLD OF GOD—suggests the fellowship enjoyed by God's family. Paul changes the figure of speech from a family to a spiritual temple in setting forth the unifying characteristic of the church, of which Christ is not only the chief cornerstone but also the foundation.
subject: Unifying Characteristic of the Church
verse_text: “Members of the household of God--having been built on the foundation of the apostles and prophets, Jesus Christ Himself being the chief cornerstone. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"And He put all things under His feet, and gave Him _

_to be head over all things to the church."_ (Eph. 1:22)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

In Old Testament times, God dwelt WITH His people. In New

Testament times, God dwells IN His people._ __IN_ Christ all

believers are fitted and formed into one building by the Holy

Spirit who regenerates and indwells them so that we are a

dwelling place FOR God.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You that You are the

center of all things and hold all things together, and

that You are the foundation of the Church. Amen.
original_reflection_text: In Old Testament times, God dwelt WITH His people. In New Testament times, God dwells IN His people. IN Christ all believers are fitted and formed into one building by the Holy Spirit who regenerates and indwells them so that we are a dwelling place FOR God.
original_verse_text: "And He put all things under His feet, and gave Him to be head over all things to the church. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks that through Christ, You have made us Your dwelling place, Your holy temple. By Your Spirit, may we be built up and strengthened in our faith, that we may honor and glorify You in all we do. Keep us from defiling this sacred space, but rather, fill us with Your presence and empower us to live as Your set-apart people. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: In Old Testament times, God dwelt with His people. In New Testament times, God dwells in His people. In Christ, all believers are fitted and formed into one building by the Holy Spirit, who regenerates and indwells them so that we are a dwelling place for God.
subject: God's Dwelling Place in You
verse_text: “And He put all things under His feet, and gave Him to be head over all things to the church. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"If indeed you have heard of the dispensation _

_of the grace of God which He made known to _

_me, "the __mystery of Christ." _(Eph. 3:2, 4c)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Paul refers to his high privilege and sacred trust of

God's universal grace to all men. Paul was merely a

channel of blessing to the Gentiles. THE MYSTERY

was God's eternal purpose in Christ.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Thank You Lord that You took care of our sin problem

through the sacrifice of Jesus on the cross of Calvary.

Guide me in the way of righteousness. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Paul refers to his high privilege and sacred trust of God's universal grace to all men. Paul was merely a channel of blessing to the Gentiles. THE MYSTERY was God's eternal purpose in Christ.
original_verse_text: "If indeed you have heard of the dispensation of the grace of God which He made known to me, "the mystery of Christ. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before you with grateful hearts, humbled by the privilege of being part of your eternal purpose in Christ. Thank you for revealing the mystery of your grace, that through Jesus, all people may be reconciled to you. Lord, fill us with your wisdom and understanding, that we may faithfully proclaim the good news of your love to all. May your will be done on earth as it is in heaven. Amen.
reflection: Paul refers to his high privilege and sacred trust of God's universal grace to all men. Paul was merely a channel of blessing to the Gentiles. The mystery was God's eternal purpose in Christ.
subject: Eternal Purpose in Christ
verse_text: “If indeed you have heard of the dispensation of the grace of God which He made known to me, “the mystery of Christ. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"THE MYSTERY OF CHRIST" which in other ages was not_

_made known to the sons of men, as it has now been_

_revealed by the Spirit to His holy apostles and prophets._

(Eph. 3;4c, 5)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Up until that time God's, revelation was frequent, BUT partial,

NOW it is full AND final. THEN there were faint gleams of light

in times and symbols, NOW there is a complete revelation. The

Holy Spirit is the agent of inspiration and illumination.

(Jn. 14:26; 16:12-15)

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

I thank You for the insights that we have received through the

apostles and prophets which were led by the Holy Spirit. Help

me to walk by the leading of the Holy Spirit. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Up until that time God's, revelation was frequent, BUT partial, NOW it is full AND final. THEN there were faint gleams of light in times and symbols, NOW there is a complete revelation. The Holy Spirit is the agent of inspiration and illumination. (John 14:26; 16:12-15)
original_verse_text: "THE MYSTERY OF CHRIST" which in other ages was not made known to the sons of men, as it has now been revealed by the Spirit to His holy apostles and prophets.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for Your full and final revelation, made known to us through Your inspired Scriptures. We marvel at the wonders of Your creation, which declare Your eternal power and divine nature. By Your Holy Spirit, grant us understanding and illumination, that we may know the depths of the mystery of Christ. May our lives reflect the truth we have received, to the glory of Your name. Amen.
reflection: Up until that time, God's revelation was frequent but partial. Now it is full and final. Then there were faint gleams of light in types and symbols; now there is a complete revelation. The Holy Spirit is the agent of inspiration and illumination. (John 14:26; 16:12-15)
subject: Revelation Now Complete and Final
verse_text: “THE MYSTERY OF CHRIST“ which in other ages was not made known to the sons of men, as it has now been revealed by the Spirit to His holy apostles and prophets.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"To me, _(Paul) _who am less than the least of all the saints,_

_this grace was given that I should preach among the Gentiles_

_the unsearchable riches of Christ. _(Eph. 3:8)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

THE UNSEARCHABLE RICHES OF CHRIST speaks of a wealth beyond

description which God provides in the person and work of

Christ.The love and grace of God is a vast and measureless

resource. If Christ were not too big for our mental comprehension, He would be to little for our spiritual need.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

I thank You Heavenly Father, for Your love and grace, which

provides all that I need. I thank You most of all for what Christ

has done for all who will receive Him as Lord and Savior. Amen.
original_reflection_text: THE UNSEARCHABLE RICHES OF CHRIST speaks of a wealth beyond description which God provides in the person and work of Christ. The love and grace of God is a vast and measureless resource. If Christ were not too big for our mental comprehension, He would be to little for our spiritual need.
original_verse_text: "To me, (Paul) who am less than the least of all the saints, this grace was given that I should preach among the Gentiles the unsearchable riches of Christ.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we stand in awe of the unsearchable riches of Christ, the boundless love and grace you have lavished upon us. Though we cannot fully fathom the depths of your mercy, we rejoice in the abundance of your kindness, the surpassing worth of knowing Jesus, and the eternal life you have graciously given us. May we continually be filled with the knowledge of your great love, that we may live as children of the light, to the praise of your glorious name. Amen.
reflection: THE UNSEARCHABLE RICHES OF CHRIST speaks of a wealth beyond description which God provides in the person and work of Christ. The love and grace of God is a vast and measureless resource. If Christ were not too big for our mental comprehension, He would be too little for our spiritual need.
subject: Unsearchable Riches of Christ
verse_text: “To me, (Paul) who am less than the least of all the saints, this grace was given that I should preach among the Gentiles the unsearchable riches of Christ.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"To make all see what is the fellowship of the mystery, _

_which from the beginning of the ages has ben hidden _

_in God who created all; things through Jesus Christ;"_

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

"TO MAKE ALL PEOPLE SEE" was Paul's purpose in preaching

the unsearchable riches of Christ. He would cause all men

to see by turning the light on. Paul was aiming at spiritual

enlightenment and spiritual apprehension. The stewardship

of the worldwide proclamation of Christ and His Gospel

should be the aim of all believers. .

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that I would be faithful in doing my

part in preaching the un-measurable riches the Gospel

of Jesus Christ. Amen.
original_reflection_text: "TO MAKE ALL PEOPLE SEE" was Paul's purpose in preaching the unsearchable riches of Christ. He would cause all men to see by turning the light on. Paul was aiming at spiritual enlightenment and spiritual apprehension. The stewardship of the worldwide proclamation of Christ and His Gospel should be the aim of all believers. .
original_verse_text: and to make plain to everyone the administration of this mystery, which for ages past was kept hidden in God, who created all things.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the unsearchable riches of Christ that You have made known to us. May Your Spirit enlighten our hearts and minds, that we may fully comprehend the mystery of Christ dwelling within us, the hope of glory. Grant us wisdom and discernment to steward the proclamation of the Gospel, that all people may see and come to know the transformative power of Your Son. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: “To Make All People See“ was Paul's purpose in preaching the unsearchable riches of Christ. He would cause all men to see by turning the light on. Paul was aiming at spiritual enlightenment and spiritual apprehension. The stewardship of the worldwide proclamation of Christ and His gospel should be the aim of all believers.
subject: Unsearchable Riches of Christ
verse_text: and to make plain to everyone the administration of this mystery, which for ages past was kept hidden in God, who created all things.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"To the intent that now the manifold wisdom of God_

_might be made known by the church to the principalities_

_and powers in the heavenly places." _(Eph. 3:10)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

It was God's "INTENT" That the mystery be made known to

Paul and now he wanted to make it known. Our greatest mission

in this life is to know Christ and make Him known. The church

is God's instrument to make known the beauty and diversity

of God's grace.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that I would be sensitive and obedient to

Your Holy Spirit's guidance in making known the beauty

and diversity of Your grace. Amen.
original_reflection_text: It was God's "INTENT" That the mystery be made known to Paul and now he wanted to make it known. Our greatest mission in this life is to know Christ and make Him known. The church is God's instrument to make known the beauty and diversity of God's grace.
original_verse_text: "To the intent that now the manifold wisdom of God might be made known by the church to the principalities and powers in the heavenly places. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging the great mystery of Your plan for our lives. May the truth of Christ dwelling within us, the hope of glory, be the driving force behind our mission to make You known to the world. Use us, Your church, as instruments to display the wondrous diversity of Your grace, that all may come to know the riches of this glorious mystery. We pray this in the name of our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ. Amen.
reflection: It was God's “intent“ that the mystery be made known to Paul, and now he wanted to make it known. Our greatest mission in this life is to know Christ and make Him known. The church is God's instrument to make known the beauty and diversity of God's grace.
subject: Unveiling the Mystery of Christ
verse_text: “To the intent that now the manifold wisdom of God might be made known by the church to the principalities and powers in the heavenly places. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"According to the eternal purpose which He accomplished _

_in Christ Jesus our Lord, in whom we have boldness and_

_access with confidence through faith in Him." _(Eph. 3:11-12)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

It is an awesome privilege to be able to approach God with

freedom and confidence. It goes without saying that most of

us would be apprehensive in the presence of a powerful ruler.

But thanks to Christ, by faith we can enter directly into God's

presence through prayer. We know we will be welcomed with

open arms, because we are God's children through our union

with Christ. Don't be afraid of God, talk to Him about everything.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your love and acceptance,

allowing me a sinner to approach You a holy God with my every

request without any fear. Amen.
original_reflection_text: It is an awesome privilege to be able to approach God with freedom and confidence. It goes without saying that most of us would be apprehensive in the presence of a powerful ruler. But thanks to Christ, by faith we can enter directly into God's presence through prayer. We know we will be welcomed with open arms, because we are God's children through our union with Christ. Don't be afraid of God, talk to Him about everything.
original_verse_text: "According to the eternal purpose which He accomplished in Christ Jesus our Lord, in whom we have boldness and access with confidence through faith in Him. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, marveling at the freedom and confidence we have to approach Your throne. Through our union with Christ, we are Your beloved children, and we can boldly enter Your presence without fear. Help us to remember that we are not strangers, but Your own, and that we can bring all our concerns and praises to You. May we always find comfort and strength in the knowledge that Your Spirit testifies with our spirit that we are Your children. Amen.
reflection: It is an awesome privilege to be able to approach God with freedom and confidence. It goes without saying that most of us would be apprehensive in the presence of a powerful ruler. But thanks to Christ, by faith we can enter directly into God's presence through prayer. We know we will be welcomed with open arms because we are God's children through our union with Christ. Don't be afraid of God; talk to Him about everything.
subject: Approach God with Confidence
verse_text: “According to the eternal purpose which He accomplished in Christ Jesus our Lord, in whom we have boldness and access with confidence through faith in Him. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Paul says: "I ask that you do not lose heart at my _

_tribulations __for you, which is your glory." _(Eph. 3:13)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Paul says: Do not lose heart - do not give into evil or act badly

because of my tribulation for you. Paul's imprisonment did not

mean that the Word of God was bound, or that the purpose of

God had failed. Opposition and difficulty are not reasons for

abandoning a divinely-appointed task.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I thank You for men of faith who remain faithful

even when dealing with the difficulties of life whether they be

physical or man made. Bless their ministry in Jesus name . Amen
original_reflection_text: Paul says: Do not lose heart - do not give into evil or act badly because of my tribulation for you. Paul's imprisonment did not mean that the Word of God was bound, or that the purpose of God had failed. Opposition and difficulty are not reasons for abandoning a divinely-appointed task.
original_verse_text: Paul says: "I ask that you do not lose heart at my tribulations for you, which is your glory. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that even in the midst of tribulation, Your purpose and plan cannot be hindered. Like the Apostle Paul, may we not lose heart when faced with adversity, but instead find strength in the knowledge that Your Word cannot be bound. Grant us the wisdom and courage to remain steadfast in our faith, knowing that our trials can serve to further the advancement of Your Kingdom. May our lives be a testament to Your unwavering love and the power of Your redeeming grace. Amen.
reflection: Paul says: Do not lose heart—do not give in to evil or act badly because of my tribulation for you. Paul's imprisonment did not mean that the Word of God was bound, or that the purpose of God had failed. Opposition and difficulty are not reasons for abandoning a divinely appointed task.
subject: Persevere Through Tribulation
verse_text: Paul says: “I ask that you do not lose heart at my tribulations for you, which is your glory. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_When I think of the wisdom and scope of God's plan,_

_I fall on my knees and pray to the Father, the Creator _

_of everything in heaven and earth." _(Eph. 3:14-15)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

If we want to receive God's blessings it is important that

we stay in contact with other believers in the body of Christ.

Those who isolate themselves from God's family and try to

go it alone cut themselves off from God's power.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, when I think about the scope of Your plan to bring all

believers, past, present, and future into one family, I am humbled

when I find that Scriptures tell me that I can be a part of that
family

in Your presence. Amen.
original_reflection_text: If we want to receive God's blessings it is important that we stay in contact with other believers in the body of Christ. Those who isolate themselves from God's family and try to go it alone cut themselves off from God's power.
original_verse_text: When I think of the wisdom and scope of God's plan, I fall on my knees and pray to the Father, the Creator of everything in heaven and earth. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, grateful for the gift of Your church, the body of Christ. Help us to embrace our unity in You, recognizing that we are all members of one another. May we not isolate ourselves, but instead stay connected to Your family, drawing strength and encouragement from our brothers and sisters in Christ. Guide us to use our unique gifts and talents to build up Your kingdom, that we may experience the fullness of Your blessings. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: If we want to receive God's blessings it is important that we stay in contact with other believers in the body of Christ. Those who isolate themselves from God's family and try to go it alone cut themselves off from God's power.
subject: Staying Connected to God's Family
verse_text: When I think of the wisdom and scope of God's plan, I fall on my knees and pray to the Father, the Creator of everything in heaven and earth. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"I pray that from His glorious, unlimited resources He _

_will give you mighty inner strength through His Holy _

_Spirit. _(Eph. 3:16)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Paul prays that this message will be spiritualty strengthened by

the power of God's Spirit. The Holy Spirit is our powerhouse.

He resides in us AND works through us. .

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the workings of Your

Holy Spirit. It is only through the power of Your Spirit which

lives within me that I can be a faithful servant for You. I pray

for a sensitivity and an obedience to Your Spirit's guidance. .
Amen.
original_reflection_text: Paul prays that this message will be spirituality strengthened by the power of God's Spirit. The Holy Spirit is our powerhouse. He resides in us AND works through us. .
original_verse_text: "I pray that from His glorious, unlimited resources He will give you mighty inner strength through His Holy Spirit.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging our need for Your divine strength and the power of Your Holy Spirit. May Your Spirit dwell within us, empowering us to stand firm in our faith and to walk in Your ways. Grant us the wisdom and discernment to understand Your will, and the courage to live it out. As we face the challenges of this world, may Your Spirit intercede on our behalf, guiding and sustaining us. We trust in Your unfailing love and the transformative work of Your Spirit within us. Amen.
reflection: Paul prays that this message will be spiritually strengthened by the power of God's Spirit. The Holy Spirit is our powerhouse. He resides in us and works through us.
subject: Empowered by God's Spirit
verse_text: “I pray that from His glorious, unlimited resources He will give you mighty inner strength through His Holy Spirit.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"I pray that Christ may dwell in your hearts by faith_

_that you may be rooted and grounded in love." _(Eph. 3:16)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Christ must be enthroned; He must have first place. It is God's

purpose that He dwell in our hearts personally, permanently,

and powerfully (Eph. 2:22). Christ is not a guest or an occasional

visitor; He is the rightful owner and lives here (Gal. 2:20)

Faith opens the door and receives Him.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that You have found a comfortable home in my

heart. I pray that I will be found faithful in Your eyes today and

always. Amen
original_reflection_text: Christ must be enthroned; He must have first place. It is God's purpose that He dwell in our hearts personally, permanently, and powerfully (Ephesians 2:22). Christ is not a guest or an occasional visitor; He is the rightful owner and lives here (Galatians 2:20) Faith opens the door and receives Him.
original_verse_text: "I pray that Christ may dwell in your hearts by faith that you may be rooted and grounded in love. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging that Christ must be enthroned in our hearts and have the rightful first place. May Your purpose be fulfilled, that Christ would dwell in us personally, permanently, and powerfully, not as a guest, but as the rightful owner of our lives. Open our hearts to receive Him by faith, that we may truly live in Him and He in us. We pray this in the name of our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ. Amen.
reflection: Christ must be enthroned; He must have first place. It is God's purpose that He dwell in our hearts personally, permanently, and powerfully (Ephesians 2:22). Christ is not a guest or an occasional visitor; He is the rightful owner and lives here (Galatians 2:20). Faith opens the door and receives Him.
subject: Enthrone Christ as Lord
verse_text: “I pray that Christ may dwell in your hearts by faith that you may be rooted and grounded in love. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"May you experience, the love of Christ THOUGH it is so_

_great you will never fully understand it. Then you will_

_be filled with the fullness of life and power that comes _

_from God." _(Eph. 3:19)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Only through union with Christ and through His empowering

Spirit do we become complete. Yes we have all the fullness of

God available to us. BUT we must appropriate that fullness through

faith and through prayer as we daily live for Him.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that Your Holy Spirit will fill every aspect

of my life to the fullest each and every day. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Only through union with Christ and through His empowering Spirit do we become complete. Yes we have all the fullness of God available to us. BUT we must appropriate that fullness through faith and through prayer as we daily live for Him.
original_verse_text: "May you experience, the love of Christ THOUGH it is so great you will never fully understand it. Then you will be filled with the fullness of life and power that comes from God. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, longing to know the love of Christ that surpasses all understanding. Fill us with Your fullness, that we may be strengthened by Your Spirit and live in accordance with Your will. Guide our prayers, for we do not know how to pray as we ought, but Your Spirit intercedes for us. May we daily abide in Christ, that we may be complete and lack nothing. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Only through union with Christ and through His empowering Spirit do we become complete. Yes, we have all the fullness of God available to us. But we must appropriate that fullness through faith and through prayer as we daily live for Him.
subject: Become Complete in Christ
verse_text: “May you experience, the love of Christ THOUGH it is so great you will never fully understand it. Then you will be filled with the fullness of life and power that comes from God. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Now glory be to God! By His mighty power at work within_

_us, He is able to accomplish infinitely more than we would _

_ever dare to ask or hope." _(Eph. 3:20)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The strength of our confidence should be in the fact that He is

VASTLY ABLE to deliver far above AND beyond all that we might ask.

Remember David's claimed in Ps. 23:5 he stated: _"My cup runneth
over." _

Remember that our highest requests are not beyond God's power to
grant.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, help me to truly examine the many blessing

I have received from you, and I will have to claim like David:

_"My cup ALSO runneth over." _ For this I humbly thank You. Amen.
original_reflection_text: The strength of our confidence should be in the fact that He is VASTLY ABLE to deliver far above AND beyond all that we might ask. Remember David's claimed in Psalm 23:5 he stated: "My cup runneth over. " Remember that our highest requests are not beyond God's power to grant.
original_verse_text: "Now glory be to God! By His mighty power at work within us, He is able to accomplish infinitely more than we would ever dare to ask or hope. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, knowing that Your power and might are far greater than anything we could ever imagine or request. Like David, we declare that our cups overflow with the abundance of Your blessings. Lord, help us to delight in You, to commit our ways to You, and to trust that You will work all things according to Your perfect will. May we experience the fullness of Your provision and the depths of Your love, for You are able to do immeasurably more than all we ask or imagine. Amen.
reflection: The strength of our confidence should be in the fact that He is vastly able to deliver far above and beyond all that we might ask. Remember David's claim in Psalm 23:5 when he stated: “My cup runneth over.“ Remember that our highest requests are not beyond God's power to grant.
subject: Vastly Able to Deliver Abundantly
verse_text: “Now glory be to God! By His mighty power at work within us, He is able to accomplish infinitely more than we would ever dare to ask or hope. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Unto Him be glory in the church by Christ Jesus through-_

_out all ages, world without end. .Amen. (_Eph. 3:21)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Christ and His church constitutes one living organism.

The church is His body, and He is the head of that one

body. THROUGHOUT ALL AGES. Is the duration of our praise

and thanksgiving. AMEN. Paul sealed the doxology.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank you for Your love which

is complete, it reach very corner of my existence. I thank

You that nothing can ever separate me from that love. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Christ and His church constitutes one living organism. The church is His body, and He is the head of that one body. THROUGHOUT ALL AGES. Is the duration of our praise and thanksgiving. AMEN. Paul sealed the doxology.
original_verse_text: Unto Him be glory in the church by Christ Jesus throughout all ages, world without end. Amen.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise and glorify Your name, for You have made Christ the head of the church, which is His body, that will endure throughout all ages. May our worship and thanksgiving to You, the eternal God, continue without end, for in Christ alone is the fullness of all things. Amen.
reflection: Christ and His church constitute one living organism. The church is His body, and He is the head of that one body. Throughout all ages is the duration of our praise and thanksgiving. Amen. Paul sealed the doxology.
subject: Praise Christ, the Church's Head
verse_text: Unto Him be glory in the church by Christ Jesus throughout all ages, world without end. Amen.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Therefore I, a prisoner for serving the Lord, beg you_

_to lead a life worthy of your calling, for you have been_

_called by God." _(Eph. 4:1)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

God has called us to be Christ's replacement on earth. In

light of this truth, Paul challenges us to live lives worthy

of the calling we have received--the awesome privilege

of being called Christ's very own. .

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I thank You for the privilege of being chosen

to be a part of Your family. Forgive me for all the times I

have fallen short of living up to Your calling. Amen.
original_reflection_text: God has called us to be Christ's replacement on earth. In light of this truth, Paul challenges us to live lives worthy of the calling we have received--the awesome privilege of being called Christ's very own. .
original_verse_text: "Therefore I, a prisoner for serving the Lord, beg you to lead a life worthy of your calling, for you have been called by God. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, humbled by the high calling You have placed upon us to be Your representatives on earth. Help us to clothe ourselves with compassion, kindness, humility, gentleness, and patience, that we may walk in a manner worthy of the gospel. Grant us the grace to bear with one another and to forgive as You have forgiven us, that the unity of the Spirit may bind us together in perfect harmony. May our lives reflect the love of Christ, so that the world may see Your glory. Amen.
reflection: God has called us to be Christ's replacement on earth. In light of this truth, Paul challenges us to live lives worthy of the calling we have received—the awesome privilege of being called Christ's very own.
subject: Worthy of Our Calling
verse_text: “Therefore I, a prisoner for serving the Lord, beg you to lead a life worthy of your calling, for you have been called by God. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Behold the Virgin shall conceive and bear a Son and_

_shall call His name Immanuel." _(God with us) (Isa. 7:14)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

There was a gift for each of us left under the TREE OF LIFE 2,000
years

ago by Him whose birthday we are celebrating today. The gift was

not withheld from anyone. Some have left the gifts unclaimed. Some

have accepted the gift and carry it around, but have failed to remove

the wrappings and look inside to discover the hidden splendor. The

packages are all alike: in each is a scroll on which is written,

_"All that the Father hath is thine. Take and live." _

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

O Lord of grace and mercy, I thank you for the greatest gift

I have ever received, the gift of eternal life which is available

to all who will confess that they are a sinner, and ask Jesus

into their heart. Amen.
original_reflection_text: There was a gift for each of us left under the TREE OF LIFE 2, 000 years ago by Him whose birthday we are celebrating today. The gift was not withheld from anyone. Some have left the gifts unclaimed. Some have accepted the gift and carry it around, but have failed to remove the wrappings and look inside to discover the hidden splendor. The packages are all alike: in each is a scroll on which is written, "All that the Father hath is thine. Take and live. "
original_verse_text: "Behold the Virgin shall conceive and bear a Son and shall call His name Immanuel."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the precious gift of Your Son, Jesus Christ, whom You sent to dwell among us as the fulfillment of the promise in Isaiah 7:14. May we not leave this gift unclaimed, but open our hearts to receive the hidden splendor of Your love and grace, as revealed in John 3:16. Help us to unwrap the fullness of all that You have provided, that we may truly live and abide in Your eternal blessings. Amen.
reflection: There was a gift for each of us left under the Tree of Life 2,000 years ago by Him whose birthday we are celebrating today. The gift was not withheld from anyone. Some have left the gifts unclaimed. Some have accepted the gift and carry it around, but have failed to remove the wrappings and look inside to discover the hidden splendor. The packages are all alike: in each is a scroll on which is written, “All that the Father hath is thine. Take and live.“
subject: Unwrap the Gift of Life
verse_text: “Behold the Virgin shall conceive and bear a Son and shall call His name Immanuel.“

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

"Glory to God in the highest heaven, and peace

on earth to whom God favors." (Lk. 2:14)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The angels song is the basis for many Christmas choral

works. The story of Jesus birth resounds in many of the

Christmas carols. But His works are more far-reaching.

Christ paid the price for sin and opened the way to peace

with God. He offers us new hearts that will last for eternity.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, the giving of Your Son that has

brought about many wonderful Christmas carols is great

but the gift of eternal life is the greatest gift of all. For

this I give You humble thanks. Amen.
original_reflection_text: The angels song is the basis for many Christmas choral works. The story of Jesus birth resounds in many of the Christmas carols. But His works are more far-reaching. Christ paid the price for sin and opened the way to peace with God. He offers us new hearts that will last for eternity.
original_verse_text: "Glory to God in the highest heaven, and peace on earth to whom God favors. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for the glorious news of Your Son's birth, which brings peace and goodwill to all people. Through Jesus, we have gained access to Your grace and the hope of eternal life. May our hearts be filled with gratitude for the salvation You have freely offered, and may we live as ambassadors of Your peace in this world. Amen.
reflection: The angels' song is the basis for many Christmas choral works. The story of Jesus' birth resounds in many of the Christmas carols. But His works are more far-reaching. Christ paid the price for sin and opened the way to peace with God. He offers us new hearts that will last for eternity.
subject: The Gift of Eternal Peace
verse_text: “Glory to God in the highest heaven, and peace on earth to whom God favors. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"We are all one body, we have the same Spirit, and _

_we have all been called to the same glorious Spirit."_

(Eph. 4:3)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Building unity is on of the Holy Spirit's important roles.

He leads, but we must be willing to be led. and to do our

part in keeping the peace. We do that by focusing on God,

not ourselves.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the gift of Your

Holy Spirit. I thank You for His presence in my life. I

pray that I would be more sensitive to His guidance, so

that I may be a better witness for You. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Building unity is on of the Holy Spirit's important roles. He leads, but we must be willing to be led. and to do our part in keeping the peace. We do that by focusing on God, not ourselves.
original_verse_text: "We are all one body, we have the same Spirit, and we have all been called to the same glorious Spirit. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, seeking Your guidance and wisdom. Help us to walk in unity, as Your Word instructs, putting aside our own desires and focusing on the greater good of Your kingdom. May the Holy Spirit lead us, empowering us to maintain the peace and harmony You desire for Your people. Grant us humility, Lord, that we may esteem others above ourselves and work together for Your glory. Amen.
reflection: Building unity is on of the Holy Spirit's important roles. He leads, but we must be willing to be led. and to do our part in keeping the peace. We do that by focusing on God, not ourselves.
subject: Cultivating Unity Through the Spirit
verse_text: “We are all one body, we have the same Spirit, and we have all been called to the same glorious Spirit. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"There is only one Lord, one faith, and one baptism._

_There is only one God and Father, who is over all_

_and living through all." _(Eph. 4:5,6)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

God is "OVER ALL" this shows us His overwhelming care.

He is "in us all" AND "living through us all" this shows us

His active presence in the world and in the lives of all

believers. Any view of God that denies this, DOES NOT

paint a true picture of God.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord I thank You for Your love and mercy, I

thank You for Your active presence in my life and

the life of all believers. Help me share the importance

of faith in our Lord Jesus Christ. Amen.
original_reflection_text: God is "OVER ALL" this shows us His overwhelming care. He is "in us all" AND "living through us all" this shows us His active presence in the world and in the lives of all believers. Any view of God that denies this, DOES NOT paint a true picture of God.
original_verse_text: "There is only one Lord, one faith, and one baptism. There is only one God and Father, who is over all and living through all. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You as the sovereign Lord who reigns over all creation. Your power and majesty are beyond our comprehension, yet You graciously dwell within us and work through us for Your eternal purposes. Help us to live in humble awareness of Your active presence, submitting to Your will and giving You the glory that is rightfully Yours. May we reflect Your love and truth to a world that desperately needs to know You. Amen.
reflection: God is “Over All,“ this shows us His overwhelming care. He is “in us all“ and “living through us all,“ this shows us His active presence in the world and in the lives of all believers. Any view of God that denies this does not paint a true picture of God.
subject: Overwhelming Care of God
verse_text: “There is only one Lord, one faith, and one baptism. There is only one God and Father, who is over all and living through all. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"The One who CAME DOWN is the one WHO ASCENDED higher _

_than all the heavens, so that His rule might fill the entire_

_universe." _(Eph. 4:10)

THOUGHTS FOR TODAY:

What we should realize by this verse is that Christ is the

ruler of the whole universe, past, present, and future.

Nothing OR NO ONE is hidden from Him. The Lord of all

the earth came and faced death to rescue all people.

No one is beyond His reach. .

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

O Lord how awesome are Your ways, they are beyond

human reasoning, but by faith in Your Word I accept

all that has been told to us. Thank You Lord for what

You did for me on the cross. Amen.
original_reflection_text: What we should realize by this verse is that Christ is the ruler of the whole universe, past, present, and future. Nothing OR NO ONE is hidden from Him. The Lord of all the earth came and faced death to rescue all people. No one is beyond His reach. .
original_verse_text: "The One who CAME DOWN is the one WHO ASCENDED higher than all the heavens, so that His rule might fill the entire universe."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for the sovereignty and authority of Your Son, our Lord Jesus Christ. He is the Ruler over all creation, the Sustainer of all things, the One who has conquered sin and death to redeem us. May we humbly submit to His Lordship, knowing that no one is beyond the reach of Your saving grace. Use us, Lord, to proclaim the good news of Your Kingdom to all people. Amen.
reflection: What we should realize by this verse is that Christ is the ruler of the whole universe, past, present, and future. Nothing or no one is hidden from Him. The Lord of all the earth came and faced death to rescue all people. No one is beyond His reach.
subject: Ruler of the Universe
verse_text: “The One who CAME DOWN is the one WHO ASCENDED higher than all the heavens, so that His rule might fill the entire universe.“

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Christ Himself gave some to be apostles, some prophets,_

_some evangelists, and some pastors and teachers, for the_

_equipping of the saints for the work of the ministry." _(Eph. 4:11,
12a)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Our oneness in Christ does not destroy our individuality.

The Holy Spirit has given each Christian special gifts for

building up the church. Now that we have been given these

gifts it is crucial that we use them.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You would forgive me

when I neglect my duties in using the gifts I have been given.

Help me become more sensitive to Your Holy Spirit's leading. .
Amen.
original_reflection_text: Our oneness in Christ does not destroy our individuality. The Holy Spirit has given each Christian special gifts for building up the church. Now that we have been given these gifts it is crucial that we use them.
original_verse_text: "Christ Himself gave some to be apostles, some prophets, some evangelists, and some pastors and teachers, for the equipping of the saints for the work of the ministry. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the diverse gifts You have bestowed upon Your people. Help us to recognize and steward the unique abilities You have entrusted to each of us, that we may faithfully serve one another and build up the body of Christ. May we humbly and joyfully use our gifts to glorify Your name and further Your kingdom. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Our oneness in Christ does not destroy our individuality. The Holy Spirit has given each Christian special gifts for building up the church. Now that we have been given these gifts, it is crucial that we use them.
subject: Embrace Your Unique Gifts
verse_text: “Christ Himself gave some to be apostles, some prophets, some evangelists, and some pastors and teachers, for the equipping of the saints for the work of the ministry. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"When we come to the true knowledge of God's Son we will_

_ not be tossed about by the winds of false doctrine." _

(Eph. 4:13b, 14a)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

As followers of Christ, this means both that our words

should be honest and our actions should reflect Christ's

integrity. .

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that I would grow more and more in

my knowledge of Your will, so that I would reflect more

of Christ's integrity. Amen.
original_reflection_text: As followers of Christ, this means both that our words should be honest and our actions should reflect Christ's integrity. .
original_verse_text: "When we come to the true knowledge of God's Son we will not be tossed about by the winds of false doctrine. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, seeking to be transformed by the renewing of our minds. Help us to put off the old self and put on the new self, which is being renewed in knowledge after the image of our Creator. May our speech be always gracious, seasoned with salt, that we may know how to answer each person. Guide us to walk in a manner worthy of the calling to which we have been called, with all humility and gentleness, bearing with one another in love. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: As followers of Christ, this means both that our words should be honest and our actions should reflect Christ's integrity.
subject: Honest Words, Christlike Actions
verse_text: “When we come to the true knowledge of God's Son we will not be tossed about by the winds of false doctrine. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Seek the Lord while He may be found. _

_Call upon Him while He is near." _(Isa. 55:6)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Has the Lord been knocking on your heart's door?

Have you made a resolution to ask Him in this new

year? Remember a resolution with no commitment

is a waste of time. .

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

O Lord, my resolution for this coming year is to have a

closer walk with You. Bless all my E-Mail contacts in

the coming year with good health and a greater sensitivity

to your Spirits presences. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Has the Lord been knocking on your heart's door? Have you made a resolution to ask Him in this new year? Remember a resolution with no commitment is a waste of time. .
original_verse_text: "Seek the Lord while He may be found. Call upon Him while He is near. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking to draw near to You. Your Word reminds us that You are always ready to be found, if we but seek You with our whole hearts. Lord, we hear Your gentle knock, and we long to open the door of our lives to welcome You in. May we make a firm commitment to walk with You, to listen to Your voice, and to follow where You lead. We desire to abide in Your presence, for in You alone do we find true fulfillment. Amen.
reflection: Has the Lord been knocking on your heart's door? Have you made a resolution to ask Him in this new year? Remember, a resolution with no commitment is a waste of time.
subject: Invite the Lord In
verse_text: “Seek the Lord while He may be found. Call upon Him while He is near. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

Paul continues: _" This I say, I testify in the Lord, that _

_you should no longer walk as the rest of the Gentiles _

_walk, in the futility of their mind." _(Eph. 4:17)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The natural tendency of human beings is to think their

way, away from God, often leaving them, "hopelessly

confused." Don't be surprised if people can't grasp the

Good News. The Good News will seem foolish to those

who forsake faith and rely on their own understanding.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

I pray that in this New Year this country would witness

a revival bring about a new generation of believers. May

this revival begin in my heart. Amen.
original_reflection_text: The natural tendency of human beings is to think their way, away from God, often leaving them, "hopelessly confused. " Don't be surprised if people can't grasp the Good News. The Good News will seem foolish to those who forsake faith and rely on their own understanding.
original_verse_text: Paul continues: " This I say, I testify in the Lord, that you should no longer walk as the rest of the Gentiles walk, in the futility of their mind. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging the natural tendency of our hearts to wander away from Your truth. We confess that without Your guidance, we can become hopelessly confused, relying on our own limited understanding. Lord, open our eyes to see the beauty and wisdom of Your Good News, that it may not seem foolish, but life-giving and transformative. Grant us the humility to submit our thoughts and ways to Yours, that we may walk in the light of Your truth. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: The natural tendency of human beings is to think their way away from God, often leaving them “hopelessly confused.“ Don't be surprised if people can't grasp the Good News. The Good News will seem foolish to those who forsake faith and rely on their own understanding.
subject: Embrace God's Wisdom, Not Worldly Folly
verse_text: Paul continues: “ This I say, I testify in the Lord, that you should no longer walk as the rest of the Gentiles walk, in the futility of their mind. “
